# BIRD-INTERACT 1.0

Content: ## üì∞ News - [2025-08-26] üöÄ We're excited to announce the release of the **[BIRD-Interact-Full (600)](https://huggingface.co/datasets/birdsql/bird-interact-full)** set! It's a tough one ‚Äî the best LLMs are only achieving a **16.33%** success rate, with just **10.0%** on the `c-interact` and `a-interact` portions. üëâ For more details, please visit our [project website](https://bird-interact.github.io/). - [2025-08-26] üì¨ We'll be sending the **Ground Truth & Test cases** to our mailing list this week. If you want early access, please send an email as instructed on the site for an **automatic download**. - [2025-08-26] üíæ On another note, we've also released a SQLite version of **[LiveSQLBench-Lite](https://huggingface.co/datasets/birdsql/livesqlbench-base-lite-sqlite)** for easier local research. The full **LiveSQLBench-Base** and **-Large** versions are coming soon! - [2025-08-22] **Bug Fix**: In Bird-Interact-Agent code, we fixed a bug that when evaluating phase-2 SQL, the stored phase-1 SQL cannot be executed successfully, leading to a lower success rate of Phase-2. This bug only affects those tasks where phase1 sql does some operations on the database, e.g. CREATE table, etc. ## üß∏ Overview BIRD-INTERACT, an interactive text-to-SQL benchmark, **re-imagines Text-to-SQL evaluation via lens of dynamic interactions**. The environment blends a hierarchical knowledge base, database documentation and a function-driven user simulator to recreate authentic enterprise environments across full **CRUD** operations. It offers two rigorous test modes: (1) passive **Conversational Interaction** and (2) active **Agentic Interaction**, spanning 600 annotated tasks including Business Intelligence (BI), CRUD operations and etc., each guarded by executable test cases. Typical evaluations trigger 1,968-5,496 interaction turns between model and user simulator, while state-of-the-art reasoning models currently solve only **‚âà24%** and **‚âà18%** of tasks, underscoring the benchmark's challenge.
Translation: ## üì∞ Actualit√©s - [2025-08-26] üöÄ Nous sommes ravis d'annoncer la sortie du set **[BIRD-Interact-Full (600)](https://huggingface.co/datasets/birdsql/bird-interact-full)** ! C'est un d√©fi ‚Äî les meilleurs LLMs n'atteignent qu'un taux de r√©ussite de **16,33%**, avec seulement **10,0%** sur les parties `c-interact` et `a-interact`. üëâ Pour plus de d√©tails, veuillez consulter notre [site projet](https://bird-interact.github.io/). - [2025-08-26] üì¨ Nous enverrons cette semaine les **Ground Truth & cas de test** √† notre liste de diffusion. Pour un acc√®s anticip√©, merci d'envoyer un e-mail selon les instructions du site pour un **t√©l√©chargement automatique**. - [2025-08-26] üíæ Par ailleurs, nous avons √©galement publi√© une version SQLite de **[LiveSQLBench-Lite](https://huggingface.co/datasets/birdsql/livesqlbench-base-lite-sqlite)** pour faciliter la recherche locale. Les versions compl√®tes **LiveSQLBench-Base** et **-Large** arrivent bient√¥t ! - [2025-08-22] **Correction de bug** : Dans le code Bird-Interact-Agent, nous avons corrig√© un bug qui, lors de l'√©valuation du SQL de phase-2, emp√™chait l'ex√©cution r√©ussie du SQL de phase-1 stock√©, entra√Ænant un taux de r√©ussite plus faible en Phase-2. Ce bug n'affecte que les t√¢ches o√π le SQL de phase1 effectue des op√©rations sur la base de donn√©es, par exemple CREATE table, etc. ## üß∏ Vue d'ensemble BIRD-INTERACT, un benchmark interactif text-to-SQL, **r√©invente l'√©valuation Text-to-SQL √† travers le prisme des interactions dynamiques**. L'environnement combine une base de connaissances hi√©rarchique, une documentation de base de donn√©es et un simulateur d'utilisateur pilot√© par fonctions pour recr√©er des environnements d'entreprise authentiques couvrant l'ensemble des op√©rations **CRUD**. Il propose deux modes de test rigoureux : (1) **Interaction Conversationnelle** passive et (2) **Interaction Agentique** active, couvrant 600 t√¢ches annot√©es incluant Business Intelligence (BI), op√©rations CRUD, etc., chacune prot√©g√©e par des cas de test ex√©cutables. Les √©valuations typiques d√©clenchent 1 968 √† 5 496 tours d'interaction entre le mod√®le et le simulateur d'utilisateur, tandis que les mod√®les de raisonnement de pointe ne r√©solvent actuellement que **‚âà24%** et **‚âà18%** des t√¢ches, ce qui souligne le d√©fi du benchmark.

Content: ### ‚úÖ Two Evaluation Modes BIRD-INTERACT supports two evaluation modes as mentioned above: - **c-Interact**: Conversational Interaction which is a passive mode and the workflow is fixed. The code and detailed information can be found in `bird_interact_conv`. - **a-Interact**: Agentic Interaction which is an embodied active mode where the workflow is dynamic and led by models. The code and detailed information can be found in `bird_interact_agent`. ### üê£ Lite Version We are releasing a lite version of BIRD-INTERACT, `bird-interact-lite-exp`, which includes 270 high-quality real-world tasks specifically for PostgreSQL. This is a good starting point for quick experimentation. ### ü¶ú Full Version The full version of BIRD-INTERACT, `bird-interact-full`, is a comprehensive benchmark that includes 600 tasks for PostgreSQL. It covers a wide range of SQL operations and user queries. The full version is coming soon. ### Model Performance Results on BIRD-INTERACT Lite #### 1. **c-Interact** Performance | Rank | Model Name | Normalized Reward | Level | |:------:|--------------------|:-------:|:--------------:| | 1 | o3-mini | 33.04 | üèÜ Excellent Chat | | 2 | GPT-4o | 30.33 | üíé Good Chat | | 3 | Gemini-2.0-flash | 27.41 | üíé Good Chat | | 4 | Claude-3.7-sonnet | 26.60 | ‚ú® Standard | | 5 | DeepSeek-R1 | 21.74 | ‚ú® Standard | | 6 | Qwen3 | 20.33 | ‚ö™ Basic | | 7 | DeepSeek-V3 | 15.85 | ‚ö™ Basic | #### 2. **a-Interact** Performance | Rank | Model Name | Budget Parameters* | Avg Steps/Task | Avg Cost (USD)/Task | Normalized Reward | Level | |:------:|--------------------|:-------------------:|:----------------:|:---------------------:|:-------------------:|:---------------------:| | 1 | Claude-3.7-sonnet | 6/6 | 15.4 | $0.6668 | 29.19 | üèÜ Excellent Interaction | | 2 | o3-mini | 6/6 | 7.8 | $0.0754 | 21.07 | üíé Good Interaction | | 3 | DeepSeek-V3 | 6/6 | 15.6 | $0.0629 | 19.19 | üíé Good Interaction | | 4 | Qwen3 | 6/6 | 12.5 | $0.0278 | 18.74 | ‚ú® Standard |
Translation: ### ‚úÖ Deux modes d‚Äô√©valuation BIRD-INTERACT prend en charge deux modes d‚Äô√©valuation comme mentionn√© ci-dessus : - **c-Interact** : Interaction conversationnelle, mode passif avec workflow fixe. Le code et les d√©tails sont disponibles dans `bird_interact_conv`. - **a-Interact** : Interaction agentique, mode actif incarn√© o√π le workflow est dynamique et guid√© par les mod√®les. Le code et les d√©tails sont disponibles dans `bird_interact_agent`. ### üê£ Version Lite Nous publions une version all√©g√©e de BIRD-INTERACT, `bird-interact-lite-exp`, comprenant 270 t√¢ches r√©elles de haute qualit√© sp√©cifiquement pour PostgreSQL. C‚Äôest un bon point de d√©part pour une exp√©rimentation rapide. ### ü¶ú Version compl√®te La version compl√®te de BIRD-INTERACT, `bird-interact-full`, est un benchmark exhaustif contenant 600 t√¢ches pour PostgreSQL. Elle couvre un large √©ventail d‚Äôop√©rations SQL et de requ√™tes utilisateur. La version compl√®te arrive bient√¥t. ### R√©sultats de performance des mod√®les sur BIRD-INTERACT Lite #### 1. **Performance c-Interact** | Rang | Nom du mod√®le | R√©compense normalis√©e | Niveau | |:------:|--------------------|:-------:|:--------------:| | 1 | o3-mini | 33.04 | üèÜ Excellente discussion | | 2 | GPT-4o | 30.33 | üíé Bonne discussion | | 3 | Gemini-2.0-flash | 27.41 | üíé Bonne discussion | | 4 | Claude-3.7-sonnet | 26.60 | ‚ú® Standard | | 5 | DeepSeek-R1 | 21.74 | ‚ú® Standard | | 6 | Qwen3 | 20.33 | ‚ö™ Basique | | 7 | DeepSeek-V3 | 15.85 | ‚ö™ Basique | #### 2. **Performance a-Interact** | Rang | Nom du mod√®le | Param√®tres Budget* | Moy. √©tapes/t√¢che | Co√ªt moy. (USD)/t√¢che | R√©compense normalis√©e | Niveau | |:------:|--------------------|:-------------------:|:----------------:|:---------------------:|:-------------------:|:---------------------:| | 1 | Claude-3.7-sonnet | 6/6 | 15.4 | $0.6668 | 29.19 | üèÜ Excellente interaction | | 2 | o3-mini | 6/6 | 7.8 | $0.0754 | 21.07 | üíé Bonne interaction | | 3 | DeepSeek-V3 | 6/6 | 15.6 | $0.0629 | 19.19 | üíé Bonne interaction | | 4 | Qwen3 | 6/6 | 12.5 | $0.0278 | 18.74 | ‚ú® Standard |

RowTranslations.originContent: - **c-Interact**: Conversational Interaction which is a passive mode and the workflow is fixed. The code and detailed information can be found in `bird_interact_conv`.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - **c-Interact** : Interaction conversationnelle, mode passif avec workflow fixe. Le code et les d√©tails sont disponibles dans `bird_interact_conv`.

RowTranslations.originContent: - **a-Interact**: Agentic Interaction which is an embodied active mode where the workflow is dynamic and led by models. The code and detailed information can be found in `bird_interact_agent`.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - **a-Interact** : Interaction agentique, mode actif incarn√© o√π le workflow est dynamique et guid√© par les mod√®les. Le code et les d√©tails sont disponibles dans `bird_interact_agent`.

RowTranslations.originContent: We are releasing a lite version of BIRD-INTERACT, `bird-interact-lite-exp`, which includes 270 high-quality real-world tasks specifically for PostgreSQL. This is a good starting point for quick experimentation.

RowTranslations.translatedContent: La version compl√®te de BIRD-INTERACT, `bird-interact-full`, est un benchmark exhaustif contenant 600 t√¢ches pour PostgreSQL. Elle couvre un large √©ventail d‚Äôop√©rations SQL et de requ√™tes utilisateur. La version compl√®te arrive bient√¥t.

RowTranslations.originContent: ### Model Performance Results on BIRD-INTERACT Lite
RowTranslations.translatedContent: ### R√©sultats de performance des mod√®les sur BIRD-INTERACT Lite

RowTranslations.translatedContent: | Rang | Nom du mod√®le       | R√©compense normalis√©e | Niveau        |

RowTranslations.translatedContent: | Rang | Nom du mod√®le       | Param√®tres Budget* | Moy. √©tapes/t√¢che | Co√ªt moy. (USD)/t√¢che | R√©compense normalis√©e | Niveau              |

Content:
| 5 | GPT-4o | 6/6 | 15.3 | $0.4594 | 18.37 | ‚ú® Standard | | 6 | Gemini-2.0-flash | 6/6 | 13.2 | $0.0337 | 17.26 | ‚ö™ Basic | | 7 | DeepSeek-R1 | 6/6 | 12.0 | $0.0931 | 17.07 | ‚ö™ Basic | > \* Budget Parameters: Starting Budget/User Patience Budget, measured by our virtual currency *bird-coin*s . Refer to [bird_interact_agent/README.md](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bird-bench/BIRD-Interact/main/bird_interact_agent/README.md#task-setting) for more details. ### Interaction-Time Scaling (ITS) Interaction-Time Scaling (ITS) refers to a model's ability to continuously increase its end performance through multi-turn interactions. When this interactive performance surpasses the model's idealized single-turn performance on a fully specified, unambiguous task, we say it satisfies the **ITS law**. As user patience grows and interaction turns accumulate, performance keeps improving, demonstrating that the model can sustain effective communication over extended dialogue. Currently, we only find claude-3-7-sonnet satisfies the ITS law.

## üì¶ Dataset Details ### Dataset Description - **Database:** The complete PostgreSQL database can be download from [the Google Drive](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KABce6czIqL9kMyIX7i-_A0CIQoDnmyW/view). Check the [Quick Eval](#quick-eval) section for more details. - **data:** Each data instance contain the following main parts: - `selected_database`: The name of the database. - `query`: The unambiguous user query. - `amb_user_query`: The user query with injected ambiguities. - `user_query_ambiguity`: The ambiguities injected into the user query. - `non_critical_ambiguity`: The non-critical ambiguities like order, limit, etc. - `knowledge_ambiguity`: The ambiguities created by masked external knowledges. - `sol_sql`: The ground truth SQL solution. - `preprocess_sql`: SQL queries to run before executing the solution or prediction. - `clean_up_sql`: SQL queries to run after the test cases to revert any changes made to the database. - `test_cases`: A set of test cases to validate the predicted corrected SQL. - `follow_up`: The labeled follow up questions. - `external_knowledge`: The external knowledge related to the specific task. - **evaluation:** The evaluation code is available in the [`./evaluation`](./evaluation) directory. - **Curated by:** BIRD Team & Google Cloud - **License:** [cc-by-sa-4.0](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/) - **HuggingFace Dataset Card:** [bird-interact-lite](https://huggingface.co/datasets/birdsql/bird-interact-lite) ### Dataset Uses
Translation:
| 5 | GPT-4o | 6/6 | 15,3 | $0,4594 | 18,37 | ‚ú® Standard | | 6 | Gemini-2.0-flash | 6/6 | 13,2 | $0,0337 | 17,26 | ‚ö™ Basic | | 7 | DeepSeek-R1 | 6/6 | 12,0 | $0,0931 | 17,07 | ‚ö™ Basic | > \* Param√®tres de budget : Budget de d√©part/Budget de patience utilisateur, mesur√©s par notre monnaie virtuelle *bird-coin*s . Voir [bird_interact_agent/README.md](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bird-bench/BIRD-Interact/main/bird_interact_agent/README.md#task-setting) pour plus de d√©tails. ### Interaction-Time Scaling (ITS) L'Interaction-Time Scaling (ITS) fait r√©f√©rence √† la capacit√© d'un mod√®le √† am√©liorer continuellement ses performances finales lors d'interactions multi-tours. Lorsque cette performance interactive d√©passe celle du mod√®le en un seul tour sur une t√¢che enti√®rement sp√©cifi√©e et non ambigu√´, on dit qu'il satisfait la **loi ITS**. √Ä mesure que la patience de l'utilisateur augmente et que les tours d'interaction s'accumulent, la performance continue de s'am√©liorer, d√©montrant que le mod√®le peut maintenir une communication efficace sur un dialogue prolong√©. Actuellement, seul claude-3-7-sonnet satisfait la loi ITS.

## üì¶ D√©tails du jeu de donn√©es ### Description du jeu de donn√©es - **Base de donn√©es :** La base PostgreSQL compl√®te peut √™tre t√©l√©charg√©e depuis [Google Drive](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KABce6czIqL9kMyIX7i-_A0CIQoDnmyW/view). Consultez la section [Quick Eval](#quick-eval) pour plus de d√©tails. - **data :** Chaque instance de donn√©es contient les √©l√©ments principaux suivants : - `selected_database` : Le nom de la base de donn√©es. - `query` : La requ√™te utilisateur non ambigu√´. - `amb_user_query` : La requ√™te utilisateur avec ambigu√Øt√©s inject√©es. - `user_query_ambiguity` : Les ambigu√Øt√©s inject√©es dans la requ√™te utilisateur. - `non_critical_ambiguity` : Les ambigu√Øt√©s non critiques comme order, limit, etc. - `knowledge_ambiguity` : Les ambigu√Øt√©s cr√©√©es par des connaissances externes masqu√©es. - `sol_sql` : La solution SQL de r√©f√©rence. - `preprocess_sql` : Requ√™tes SQL √† ex√©cuter avant la solution ou la pr√©diction. - `clean_up_sql` : Requ√™tes SQL √† ex√©cuter apr√®s les cas de test pour annuler les modifications apport√©es √† la base. - `test_cases` : Un ensemble de cas de test pour valider le SQL corrig√© pr√©dit. - `follow_up` : Les questions de suivi √©tiquet√©es. - `external_knowledge` : Les connaissances externes li√©es √† la t√¢che sp√©cifique. - **evaluation :** Le code d‚Äô√©valuation est disponible dans le r√©pertoire [`./evaluation`](./evaluation). - **Curat√© par :** √âquipe BIRD & Google Cloud - **Licence :** [cc-by-sa-4.0](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/) - **Carte du jeu de donn√©es HuggingFace :** [bird-interact-lite](https://huggingface.co/datasets/birdsql/bird-interact-lite) ### Usages du jeu de donn√©es

RowTranslations.originContent: > \* Budget Parameters: Starting Budget/User Patience Budget, measured by our virtual currency *bird-coin*s . Refer to [bird_interact_agent/README.md](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bird-bench/BIRD-Interact/main/bird_interact_agent/README.md#task-setting) for more details.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: > \* Param√®tres de budget : Budget de d√©part/Budget de patience utilisateur, mesur√©s par notre monnaie virtuelle *bird-coin*s . Voir [bird_interact_agent/README.md](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bird-bench/BIRD-Interact/main/bird_interact_agent/README.md#task-setting) pour plus de d√©tails.

RowTranslations.originContent: Interaction-Time Scaling (ITS) refers to a model's ability to continuously increase its end performance through multi-turn interactions. When this interactive performance surpasses the model's idealized single-turn performance on a fully specified, unambiguous task, we say it satisfies the **ITS law**. As user patience grows and interaction turns accumulate, performance keeps improving, demonstrating that the model can sustain effective communication over extended dialogue. Currently, we only find claude-3-7-sonnet satisfies the ITS law.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: L'Interaction-Time Scaling (ITS) fait r√©f√©rence √† la capacit√© d'un mod√®le √† am√©liorer continuellement ses performances finales lors d'interactions multi-tours. Lorsque cette performance interactive d√©passe celle du mod√®le en un seul tour sur une t√¢che enti√®rement sp√©cifi√©e et non ambigu√´, on dit qu'il satisfait la **loi ITS**. √Ä mesure que la patience de l'utilisateur augmente et que les tours d'interaction s'accumulent, la performance continue de s'am√©liorer, d√©montrant que le mod√®le peut maintenir une communication efficace sur un dialogue prolong√©. Actuellement, seul claude-3-7-sonnet satisfait la loi ITS.

RowTranslations.originContent: style="width: 100%; min-width: 100px; display: block; margin: auto; ">
RowTranslations.translatedContent: style="width: 100%; min-width: 100px; display: block; margin: auto; ">

RowTranslations.originContent: - **Database:** The complete PostgreSQL database can be download from [the Google Drive](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KABce6czIqL9kMyIX7i-_A0CIQoDnmyW/view). Check the [Quick Eval](#quick-eval) section for more details.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - **Base de donn√©es :** La base PostgreSQL compl√®te peut √™tre t√©l√©charg√©e depuis [Google Drive](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KABce6czIqL9kMyIX7i-_A0CIQoDnmyW/view). Consultez la section [Quick Eval](#quick-eval) pour plus de d√©tails.

RowTranslations.originContent: - **data:** Each data instance contain the following main parts:
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - **data :** Chaque instance de donn√©es contient les √©l√©ments principaux suivants :
- `selected_database` : Le nom de la base de donn√©es.

RowTranslations.originContent: - `amb_user_query`: The user query with injected ambiguities.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - `amb_user_query` : La requ√™te utilisateur avec ambigu√Øt√©s inject√©es.

RowTranslations.originContent: - `user_query_ambiguity`: The ambiguities injected into the user query.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - `user_query_ambiguity` : Les ambigu√Øt√©s inject√©es dans la requ√™te utilisateur.

RowTranslations.originContent: - `non_critical_ambiguity`: The non-critical ambiguities like order, limit, etc.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - `non_critical_ambiguity` : Les ambigu√Øt√©s non critiques comme order, limit, etc.

RowTranslations.originContent: - `knowledge_ambiguity`: The ambiguities created by masked external knowledges.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - `knowledge_ambiguity` : Les ambigu√Øt√©s cr√©√©es par des connaissances externes masqu√©es.

RowTranslations.originContent: - `preprocess_sql`: SQL queries to run before executing the solution or prediction.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - `preprocess_sql` : Requ√™tes SQL √† ex√©cuter avant la solution ou la pr√©diction.

RowTranslations.originContent: - `clean_up_sql`: SQL queries to run after the test cases to revert any changes made to the database.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - `clean_up_sql` : Requ√™tes SQL √† ex√©cuter apr√®s les cas de test pour annuler les modifications apport√©es √† la base.

RowTranslations.originContent: - `test_cases`: A set of test cases to validate the predicted corrected SQL.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - `test_cases` : Un ensemble de cas de test pour valider le SQL corrig√© pr√©dit.

RowTranslations.originContent: - `external_knowledge`: The external knowledge related to the specific task.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - `external_knowledge` : Les connaissances externes li√©es √† la t√¢che sp√©cifique.

RowTranslations.originContent: - **evaluation:** The evaluation code is available in the [`./evaluation`](./evaluation) directory.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - **evaluation :** Le code d‚Äô√©valuation est disponible dans le r√©pertoire [`./evaluation`](./evaluation).

Content:
To avoid data leakage by auto-crawling, we do not include GT solution sqls and test cases along with data.
please email [bird.bench25@gmail.com](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bird-bench/BIRD-Interact/main/mailto:bird.bench25@gmail.com) with the tag `[bird-interact-lite GT&Test Cases]` in title for full set, which will be sent automatically.

<!-- ### Utiliser le jeu de donn√©es depuis HuggingFace

RowTranslations.originContent: You can download the dataset from HuggingFace using the following command:
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Vous pouvez t√©l√©charger le jeu de donn√©es depuis HuggingFace en utilisant la commande suivante :

Content:
```bash
from datasets import load_dataset
# Load the flash version of the dataset
dataset = load_dataset("birdsql/bird-interact-lite")
print(dataset["lite"][0])

# Load the full version of the dataset (coming soon)
dataset = load_dataset("birdsql/bird-interact-full")
print(dataset["full"][0])
```
Translation:
```bash
from datasets import load_dataset
# Load the flash version of the dataset
dataset = load_dataset("birdsql/bird-interact-lite")
print(dataset["lite"][0])

# Load the full version of the dataset (coming soon)
dataset = load_dataset("birdsql/bird-interact-full")
print(dataset["full"][0])
```

Content: Or you can use the provided script to download the full version of the dataset and split it into different dialects.
Translation: Ou vous pouvez utiliser le script fourni pour t√©l√©charger la version compl√®te du jeu de donn√©es et le diviser en diff√©rents dialectes.

Content:
```bash
cd baseline/data
python pull_data.py \
  --schema_path path/to/full_schema.jsonl \
  --input_path path/to/input.jsonl \ # Path to the input JSONL file (may be empty if you want to download the dataset from HuggingFace)
  --output_folder path/to/output_dir # output folder of the split files
``` -->
Translation:
```bash
cd baseline/data
python pull_data.py \
  --schema_path chemin/vers/full_schema.jsonl \
  --input_path chemin/vers/input.jsonl \ # Chemin vers le fichier JSONL d'entr√©e (peut √™tre vide si vous souhaitez t√©l√©charger le jeu de donn√©es depuis HuggingFace)
  --output_folder chemin/vers/output_dir # dossier de sortie des fichiers divis√©s
```
